patches.reasoning: Developed Cycle 3 to help pupils understand the impact of Roman departure on British tribes.

value.title: Impact on British tribes after Roman departure

spokenExplanation: Discuss how British tribes had to reorganise and adapt following the Roman departure.
Explain the challenges faced by tribes without Roman protection and support.
Highlight the emergence of new leaders and alliances among tribes.
Describe the influence of Roman culture that remained in local customs and infrastructure.
Connect to prior knowledge of Roman influence and its significance on daily life in Britain.
explanation.accompanyingSlideDetails: Images showing tribal life and changes in Britain post-Roman rule.
explanation.slideText: The departure of the Romans led to significant changes and challenges for British tribes.

checkForUnderstanding.question: What did British tribes have to do after the Romans left?
What influence remained in Britain after the Romans?

value.practice: Identify two ways in which British tribes adapted after the Romans left. Use examples from the lesson to explain your answers.
value.feedback: Model answer: British tribes adapted by forming new alliances and incorporating Roman culture into their daily lives.
